result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey N. Newkirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 2:32pm [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey N. Newkirk in court, with Attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Teuber submits an Amended Information
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--The Court finds that the reduction in charges is appropriate
--The Amended Information is approved by the COurt

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1, #2, and #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis given; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 

On Count #1 of the Amended Information:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; TIME SERVED
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 


On Count #2 of the Amended Information:
The Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, this sentence is to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #1; TIME SERVED
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

On Count #3 of the Amended Information:
The Court sentences the Defendant to: 
--serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, this sentence is to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #1 and concurrent to the sentence in Count #2; TIME SERVED 
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

Days Credit: 361 days

All Costs/Fees, totalling, $1329 plus $467 in subpoena fees= $1,796,to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 12/31/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a  36 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
recess: 3:07pm
for continuance and further that the the future dates remain as scheduled
Proposed STAO to continue the 11/24/15 STC
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 10/14/2015

Case called at 8:40am [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC]
Defendant Jeffrey N. Newkirk in court, in custody with Attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to the Court's granted request for continuance:
--The Court and Counsel discuss re-scheduling of trial 
--Counsel is to check the availability of witnesses

As part of the stipulation for continuance, there is also a stipulation to modify Mr. Newkirk's bond from cash to a signature
--Atty. Wolter gives arguments
--Upon inquiry from the Court, DA Happ recites Mr. Newkirk's prior convictions

The Court modifies Mr. Newkirk's bond from $10,000 Cash to $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:

--no contact with the alleged victim NEN (dob 3/4/08) or with NEN's mother
(*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

--no presence at the residence of NEN or within 1000 feet of her residence
--no contact with any child under the age of 18 
--not to discuss the facts of this case with Whitney Newkirk or her parents
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin while this case is pending. 

The Court advises Mr. Newkirk that his last opportunity to enter a plea will be at the FSSC
recess: 9:04am
NEXT: (1) Status Conference on 11/24/15 at 1:30pm (2)FSSC on 12/10/15 at 2:30pm (3) Jury Trial on 12/14--12/16/15 at 8:30am
Proposed stip and order for continuance w/cover letter
Proposed stip and order for continuance
Letter from Attorney Wolter requesting hearing set for 06-18-2015 be taken off of the calendar
Jury trial on August 3, 4 & 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on July 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 10:39am [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey N. Newkirk in court, in custody with attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Wolter indicates that a revocation hearing on another case pends, further she indicates that this case will likely go to Trial
ADA Teuber does not object to the Court scheduling a Jury Trial, she requests it be set out atleast 60 days.
The Court schedules a three day Jury Trial 
The Court reminds Mr. Newkirk that his last opportunity to enter a plea prior to trial will be the FSSC date.
The Court and Counsel discuss filing of motions
recess: 10:48am

NEXT:(1) Motion Hearing: June 18, 2015 at 1:30pm (2) FSSC: July 28, 2015 at 9:00am (3) Jury Trial: August 3, 4, & 5, 2015 at 8:30am
Status conference on May 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on April 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey N. Newkirk in court, in custody, with Attorny Jacquelyn Wolter. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered

Case called at 8:48am[MO]
Defendant Jeffrey N. Newkirk in court, in custody, with Attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Newkirk waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

ADA Hall requests that arraignment be scheduled in approximately in 30 days.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
Recess: 8:50am

NEXT: Arraignment 3/13/2015 at 1:30pm
Preliminary hearing on February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Reserve Judge Klossner presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:36am. [MK]
Defendant Jeffrey N. Newkirk in court, in custody, with Attorney Jacquelyn Wolter.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
The Court informs Mr. Newkirk that he has the right to remain silent. 
Attorney Wolter requests that a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled, however the Defense is waiving the time limits.
The State requests that the Preliminary Hearing be scheduled within the time limits. However when scheduling of the Preliminary Hearing date/time is discussed, the State agrees to extend the time limits so that the hearing can occur on February 13th.

The Court requires a $10,000 Cash Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with the alleged victim NEN (dob 3/4/08) or with NEN's mother
--no presence at the residence of NEN
--no contact with any child under the age of 18 
--not to discuss the facts of this case with Whitney Newkirk or her parents
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
recess 9:50am.

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 2/13/15 at 8:30am.
